sentences.english: You can also create ringtones out of songs you downloaded.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以将你下载的歌曲制作成手机铃声。

sentences.english: God knows that , and created us totally free.
sentences.chinese: 上主深明此理，因此将我们创造成了自由。

sentences.english: Soon he became the top student at school.
sentences.chinese: 很快他便成了学校里的尖子生。

sentences.english: The idea of bringing revolution to the countryside had turned out to be a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 改造农村的革命理想成了虚妄的幻想。

sentences.english: Engage your core muscles, then curl your upper body towards a sitting position.
sentences.chinese: 调动人体核心部位的肌肉力量向上抬体，成坐姿。

sentences.english: Putin describes his younger self as a poor student and a "hooligan."
sentences.chinese: 普京把少年时的自己形容成差生。

sentences.english: My 6-year old brother and I became her constant bodyguards.
sentences.chinese: 我和6岁的弟弟成了她的贴身保镖。

sentences.english: As it is I have been forced into becoming a sort of pamphleteer.
sentences.chinese: 事实是，我被迫成了一名写小册子的作家。

sentences.english: They counterchanged the floor in the bedroom with several colours.
sentences.chinese: 他们把卧室的地板铺成交错的颜色。

sentences.english: Deception and deceptive, gradually became the most people.
sentences.chinese: 自欺与欺人，渐渐成了大多数人的爱好。

sentences.english: The sky is blue and fields are green and laughter is the language of the world.
sentences.chinese: 蓝天碧草之间笑声成了世亖界通用的语言。

sentences.english: "Never say never" is one of my new expressions.
sentences.chinese: 如今，“决不说‘决不’”成了我新的口头禅之一。

sentences.english: But that dominance is now in question.
sentences.chinese: 但现在的主导地位成了问题。

sentences.english: GIFs serve as a window into US celebrity culture.
sentences.chinese: 动图还成了观察美国名人文化的窗口。

sentences.english: The woman's beauty made her a rare bird indeed.
sentences.chinese: 美貌确实使她成了一个绝世佳人。

sentences.english: Passion alone cannot win the revolution; Passion just makes martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 光靠满腔热血，不会使革命成，只能制造烈士。

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
again/once more/re-/second/another/then (after sth, and not until then)/no matter how ... (followed by an adjective or verb, and then (usually) 也[ye3] or 都[dou1] for emphasis)
is/are/am/yes/to be
variant of 是[shi4]/(used in given names)
handle
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to come out/to appear/to arise
originally/original
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
